content.description: The graphs show best-fit lines for four different processes through which an ideal gas is taken.
content.question: The graph for process 1 shows pressure <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of volume <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at constant temperature. The graph for process 2 shows pressure <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of temperature <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at constant volume. The graph for process 3 shows volume <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of temperature <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at constant pressure. The graph for process 4 shows volume <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of the number of moles of gas <math alttext="n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at constant pressure and temperature. Which of the following equations is consistent with the data represented in the graphs?

choices.label: <math alttext="P equals the fraction n R T over V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>n</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P V n equals R T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>n</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction P over V equals n R T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>V</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>n</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P T equals the fraction n R over V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mi>T</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>n</mi><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P equals the fraction n R T over V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>n</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
